channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fractured News Remmy Awards Nominations: Crushing on a Judge, Lighting a Bridge, and Dumping Chickens
GOP lawmakers turn up pressure on Biden over Iran nuclear program: 'Enough is enough'
item.description: Sen. Tim Scott and Rep. Mike Lawler will introduce a resolution Monday afternoon urging the Biden administration to censure Iran at the IAEA meeting.

item.title: Rep. McCormick to Newsmax: Fauci Embarrassed to Admit COVID Lab Leak
item.description: Rep. Rich McCormick, R-Ga., told Newsmax on Monday there is only one reason why Dr. Anthony Fauci, former head of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, is unwilling to embrace a lab leak theory as the origin of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Fauci Hearing: The Accountability That Will Never Come
Rep Jordan urges Congress to 'defund lawfare activities' of Trump prosecutors
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan is proposing to “defund the lawfare activities" of state and federal prosecutors leading “politically sensitive investigations."

item.title: Rep. Biggs to Newsmax: Block Dems to Support Trump
item.description: Rep. Andy Biggs, R-Ariz., told Newsmax on Monday that he supports the protest of a group of Republican congressmen decrying Donald Trump's conviction in his New York trial by refusing to cooperate with Democrat legislative priorities or nominations by President Joe Biden.

item.title: Pure Politics: Biden Expected to Sign Executive Order to Seal the Border and Restrict Asylum
First on Fox: How the migrant crisis overwhelmed DC public schools
item.description: New emails are revealing the extent to the strain placed on schools by the ongoing migrant crisis at the southern border after more migrants headed to the nation's capital.

item.title: Congress Expands Antisemitism Probe to 10 Colleges
item.description: Six congressional oversight committees on Monday reportedly initiated an investigation into antisemitism at 10 prestigious colleges - laying the groundwork to potentially cut off billions in federal funding.

item.title: Vindictive Dems Blast Out Fundraising Emails Demanding Trump Receive 'Maximum Sentence Allowed by Law'
Democratic Minnesota state senator’s own party calling for her resignation after burglary charge
item.description: Democratic Minnesota state Sen. Nicole Mitchell is now facing calls to resign from her own party after she was charged with first-degree burglary in April.

item.title: Ohio Sen. Vance Rises in Trump's Veepstakes
item.description: Sen. Vance, R-Ohio, could be former President Donald Trump's pick for vice president. According to The Hill, the first-term senator and bestselling author of "Hillbilly Elegy" is one of the top contenders to be Trump's vice-presidential nominee.

item.title: Potential Jurors on Hunter Biden Case Face Questions on Guns, Addiction With Some Surprising Results
Biden issues permit to expand, maintain border crossings across Texas
item.description: President Biden authorized the expansion of border crossing facilities across Texas on Monday.

item.title: Rep. Cline to Newsmax: Hunter Biden Case 'No Comparison' to Trump's
item.description: Rep. Ben Cline, R-Va., told Newsmax on Monday that there's "no comparison" between what's happening with Hunter Biden's criminal gun trial in Delaware and former President Donald Trump's New York paperwork trial.
